question.text: Identify the incorrect statement from the following.

options.text: All the five <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> orbitals have shapes similar to the respective <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> orbitals.
In an atom, all the five <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> orbitals are equal in energy in free state.

The shapes of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mrow><mi>xy</mi><mo>,</mo></mrow></msub><mo> </mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi>yz</mi></msub></math>, and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi>zx</mi></msub></math> orbitals are similar to each other; and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mrow><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msub></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msub></math> are similar to each other.
All the five <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> orbitals are different in size when compared to the respective 4d orbitals.

solution.text:
The shapes of 3d orbital are same as respective 4d and 5d orbitals, only the size of the orbital changes, when the respective shell number increases. All the d-orbitals are degenerate(equal energy) orbitals in the free state.

The shapes of the dxy,dyz and dxz are same.

The shapes of the dx2-y2 and dz2 are different.
